page.title: 13NUTLEY WINDMILL
page.content: There are only four windmills of this primitive type in the country. About 300 years old, it is an open trestle post mill with the body of the mill balanced so perfectly on a single post that it only needs the strength of one man to turn it into the wind. The post and trestle are open to the elements, which is an unusual feature. The small gears are of iron and the larger of wood which was considered to be the best combination. The millstones, meal grading machinery, sack hoist and other machines are still there, including the brake. Flour is still ground occasionally and sold. The Windmill has been restored by the Uckfield Preservation Society and is open to the public once a month and at Bank Holidays in the summer months.
